title: BISP, JazzCash team up for digital empowerment of its beneficiaries
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 02 (APP): Benazir Income Support Programme (BISP) will collaborate with JazzCash for digital empowerment of its beneficiaries.
A meeting to discuss modalities of this joint venture was held between the Chairperson of the Benazir Income Support Programme (BISP), Senator Rubina Khalid and a delegation from JazzCash, led by Ibrar Khan, Vice President Corporate Affairs, and Ali Naseer, Chief Strategic Officer.
The meeting focused on enhancing the financial and digital inclusion of BISP’s women beneficiaries by providing them with smartphones.
Senator Rubina Khalid emphasized the directive from both the President and Prime Minister of Pakistan to ensure that BISP beneficiaries receive their payments with complete transparency and respect.
She highlighted that digital empowerment through smartphones is vital in bridging the communication gap between BISP and its beneficiaries, enabling them to be fully aware of their rights and reducing the risk of fraud.
The chairperson also stressed BISP’s commitment to improving the lives of its beneficiaries by offering market-driven skill training that aligns with employment opportunities.
During the meeting, the JazzCash team presented potential initiatives for collaboration.
Senator Rubina Khalid urged the team to develop a detailed implementation plan for the digital empowerment of BISP beneficiaries.
